attributes.action: Change Just in Case medication policy to Debbiebox a NHS Standard practice in GP
attributes.background: My mum spent 4 hour dying in pain due to MAR chart missing. Ambulance Crew couldn't give drugs needed. My mum died hospital 1hr pain free. I had to watch her. Just in Case box is NOT standard practice. We want a Debbiebox in place in every GP with MAR, DNS and drugs and comes direct from GP.
attributes.additional_details:
The MAR charts was not requested at my GP and was missed out.  District nurse request a JUST IN CASE BOX. This GP didn't have a box policy.

The Debbiebox is a palliative care box which will have telephone numbers, drugs, MAR chart and DNR form, syringes it will be done by a GP alone.

Currently each GP has their own policy it should be standard practice so no miscommunication happens resulting in mistakes and someone dying in pain. 
This would stop compensation claims and is cost effective.

attributes.action: Refund child maintenance if DNA testing proves a man isn't the biological Father
attributes.background:
My husband recently discovered that the child he has been raising for almost six years is not biologically his, following DNA testing.

As the Mother had always maintained that he was the father, he has been paying maintenance through the CSA for five years. 

He has no legal right to a refund.
attributes.additional_details:
The only way to attempt to get the money back is by claiming fraud in court which is costly, time consuming and not guaranteed. 

This is totally unfair and I believe the Mother should have a legal obligation to pay this money back via an attachment of earnings or a deduction of benefits, in the same way that Father's are forced to pay maintenance by the government.

Please sign this petition to have the issue debated in parliment, and bring about change in a system which unfairly favours women.

attributes.action: Repeal part of the Legal Services Act 2007 to abolish the SRA and LSB
attributes.background: The Legal Services Act 2007 imposed a highly complex structure for regulation of solicitors.  It is expensive to run and gave the public no greater protections.  If regulation can revert to The Law Society (supervised by the Ministry of Justice), the money saved can be used to finance legal aid.

attributes.action: Make publishing a false statement illegal
attributes.background: A publication that makes a factually incorrect statement – for whatever reason – and is proved to have done so, will have to publish a correction in the same prominence, location and size as the original false statement.
attributes.additional_details:
In a democracy, the key for debating and arguing ideas is a respect for the facts on which we base our opinions and views of the world. It’s the level playing field we must all respect. Opinions, predictions, and forecasts are quite different and would not be covered by such a law so long as they are clearly noted as such.  

This proposed law is not intended to cover persons as that is already covered by the law of slander and libel.

attributes.action: Brexit should NOT include free movement of people or contributions to EU funds.
attributes.background: We have voted to leave the EU and should not pay into it. They need to trade with us more than we need them.

attributes.action: Implement a statutory body to deal with animal welfare prosecutions
attributes.background: The animal welfare crisis is spiralling out of control the government are in denial,enforcement and prosecution is lacking on a large scale.Animals need a robust and enforced system.It must move on from private prosecution and the state should prosecute as it does in every other area of the law.

attributes.action: When failing qts tests, Remove the 2 Year ban after failing tests 3 times
attributes.background: When future trainee teachers fail there qts tests 3 times, there is a two year ban for re-sitting the tests. However when a person fails there theory test 3 times, they do not get a two year ban. I suggest the ban be removed. The tests should be re-sat unlimited times, until passed.
attributes.additional_details: The tests will still need to be passed therefore the same high standard is set.

attributes.action: To consider protecting CC41&11011 the historic symbols under IPO article 6_ter
attributes.background: I would like you to consider protecting the historic expired marks CC41 and 11011 under article 6_ter or equivalent Non EU regulation so that it remains free to use by the people and not that of sole property of an individual so that they are able to gain financial reward.
attributes.additional_details: It recently came to my attention that an individual has successfully published the iconic CC41, I intend to fully challange the Mark personally and have appealed and invited the millions of Brits to join me in this campaign,  so that the trademark CC41 is not granted solely to the individual Mr Douglas Steward, further information of this can be found on the IPO website under the words "CC41" The double 11s symbol 11011, another iconic symbol I also wish you to consider protecting.

attributes.action: Guarantee a minimum standard of contraceptive availability across the UK
attributes.background: The Independent and BBC report that funding cuts have caused some GPs to stop providing the contraceptive coil, IUD and contraceptive implant. It makes no sense to reduce access to cost-effective, proven modern contraceptive innovations; local authorities must receive adequate funds to provide this.
attributes.additional_details: Access to a full range of contraception prevents pregnancy (abortions and raising unplanned children are both more costly) and is vital for managing many health problems (thyroid malfunction, severe migraine/period pain, endometriosis). Government must a) require ring-fenced, guaranteed contraceptive funding (and reinstate provisions where cut) b) enforce minimum provisions: amount of options discussed with patients and available within a certain distance, and availability of long-acting methods

attributes.action: Include all domestic pets to the Road Traffic Act 1988
attributes.background: The Road Traffic Act 1988 states drivers must report incidents involving horse, cattle, ass, mule, sheep, pigs, goats and dogs. This was sufficient for these working animals at the time the legislation was set. In contemporary times, the government should add domestic companions to this list.
attributes.additional_details: A working animal, usually domesticated, is kept by humans and trained to perform tasks which tends to give them a special status within the law. Today there are a wide range of domestic animals kept in the UK who deserve to be included in the act. For example, today Cats are successfully used as companions for the sick and disabled in care programs. They have served in the agricultural sector and in the military over many years. The Act must be updated to reflect these modern relationships.

attributes.action: Increase free and confidential mental health support for students aged 13-25
attributes.background: Recently there have been drastic cuts to mental health services, even though many school students are affected by mental illness; this need has been further heightened by an increase of suicide in universities.

attributes.action: To prevent seismic testing & fracking by Ineos in Dronfield & surrounding areas
attributes.background:
Ineos (owned by an offshore parent company) has been awarded the fracking rights by the Government for Dronfield and its surrounding areas. 
We believe fracking is unproven technology, environmentally damaging in numerous ways, presents a health risk to both the general public and its workers.
attributes.additional_details:
Dronfield Against Fracking oppose seismic testing & fracking for various reasons including:
1. Long term damage to countryside from an aesthetic point of view.
2. Risk of structural damage to property from damage to old mine workings from both horizontal and vertical drilling.
3. Large increase in traffic from HGV's on country roads.
4. Falling property prices.
5. Invalidate some household insurance policies from fracking damage.
6. Polluted waste water entering our water course in future years.

attributes.action: Let private hire vehicles use bus lanes just like black cabs can
attributes.background: We as private hire drivers do the same job as bus drivers and black cab drivers so why ain't we allowed to use bus lanes

attributes.action: Get the government to licence the use of PD-1 immunotherapy to treat cancer
attributes.background: I was shocked to learn of a 36 year old woman who had to pay £50K for this to treat secondary lung cancer following treatment for Breast Cancer. It should be available in the UK.
attributes.additional_details: My Oncologist agrees it works.

attributes.action: Stop agencies fining those who cannot attend work because of an emergency
attributes.background: Agencies are currently able to issue fines to workers if they do not give 48 hours prior notice that they are unable to attend a shift. If they have an emergency or illness in that 48 hour window they will be fined, whether or not they provide a reason.
attributes.additional_details:
One agency that does this is ROTA, which provides hospitality staff. Given that it is illegal to handle food within 48 hours of diarrhoea or vommiting you could effectively be fined for abiding by the law. 

It is outrageous to fine some of the lowest paid in our society. They already give up a lot of rights by having to take zero hour contracts, and to fine those in the most precarious of employment is deplorable.

attributes.action: Ban the production and selling of mink lashes!
attributes.background: Mink eyelashes are a growing trend,but these animals are put through a huge amount of pain just for there fur. The animals are kept in confind cages and factory's. None of this is humane. All for humans to look "nice" while these animals have no say if people can use there fur,and through pain.
attributes.additional_details: No use of animal fur is humane.

attributes.action: Give the local authority the power to direct academy schools to take a child.
attributes.background: Our 8 year old son with additional needs suffered sustained & violent bullying from a child over 4 years culminating in a significant mental health breakdown. The school can not & will not deal with the bullying. We now cannot get our son into a new school.
attributes.additional_details: Our son was removed from school to safeguard him as the school we were moving him to had conceded an appeal to take him meaning only out of school for 2 weeks, only for the new school to then rescind the offer, two further schools will now not accept him, all three sighting they require an educational health care plan to review first. No agency appears to be interested to grip this, EFA have sent it back to the local authority who have no authority over academies. 106 days out of education now.

attributes.action: Make it illegal to sell tickets for more than 25% the face value!
attributes.background:
So today I tried to buy Red Hot Chilli Pepper tickets but at exactly 10am there were no tickets available. I was directed to ticketmasters sister site 'getmein' where the tickets were over 50% the original face value. 
We want to support the band, we do not want to support the touts!

attributes.action: Unemployment and behaviour rehabilitation.  National service.
attributes.background:
1. Children/Adults on leaving school will be enrolled in a national service programme if they are not in employment or further education with 3 months of leaving school.

2. Young offenders 16-25 are entered into the national service programme for rehabilitation.
attributes.additional_details:
1a. They will recieve a set of skills and further education for a good platform in life and to be a working citizen.
1b. They recieve a wage which pays taxes back not benefits.
1c. Money taken and put into a fund for them when service is finished to help them with a start in life.

2a. Takes down over crowding in prisons.
2b. Gives them a set of skills and trade to give back something to community's. Something were they feel wanted.
2c. Reduces tax payers costs to prisoners.
2d. Pays taxes back.

attributes.action: Parliament to debate whether it is possible to make a success of leaving the EU.
attributes.background: The Government has repeatedly stated it is determined to "make a success" of Brexit. While 52% of eligible voters may have voted to leave the EU, mere determination to make a success out of Brexit is insufficient. The notion Brexit can be successful is not supported by evidence and must be debated.
attributes.additional_details: Potential consequences include the UK leaving the Single Market and the break-up of the UK (both contrary to pledges made in the Conservative Manifesto); a plunge in the value of sterling (which hit a 168-year low following the referendum); few trading partners (diplomats for India, Canada, the US & Australia have stated they prioritise the EU over the UK); the loss of sovereignty over Gilbratar (a red line for Spain in negotiations); no deal with the EU (the 18-month timeframe is unrealistic).

attributes.action: Create an impartial ombudsman to put PIP mandatory service levels in place
attributes.background: The DWP want to cut costs, but the costs are rising due to disabled people having to have claim reviewed and then appealed. A high number of cases are overturned at appeal meaning PIP is paid plus the administration of reviewing a case which should have been awarded in the first place.
attributes.additional_details:
pip sucess rate new claimants 47%
pip sucess rate DLA to PIP migrations 74%
pip sucess rate average overall 60.5 % (before tribunals)
pip failure rate 39.5%
65% of claimants will go to tribunal 

The ombudsman should be able to put statutory service levels in place to protect disabled people and the DWP against failures of quality made by 3rd party contractors such as atos and capita

attributes.action: Enforce disabled access in the UK rather than ignoring the issue
attributes.background:
Too many businesses in the UK do not have disabled access or even staff that are trained about the equality act and making reasonable adjustments.

Its time the UK took action to make disabled access mandatory in all businesses and for those who fail to be fined by their local authority.
attributes.additional_details:
Too many businesses in the UK do not have disabled access or even staff that are trained about the equality act and making reasonable 
adjustments for disabled people to have equal access to their services.

Its time councils had the power to issue fines, warnings and even court action against businesses that fail to comply with disability access law. Too little is being done to enforce this and a good number of disabled people do not have the energy to take these issues through court.

attributes.action: Introduce Government subsidies on public transport for full time students.
attributes.background: Studying in full time education can cost families a sufficient amount of money each year on transport to school and recreational activities which they may not have. This can cost families and students thousands of pounds every year which they can spend on other costs in the household like books.
attributes.additional_details: For a bus ticket from Seaton to Exeter it costs a student £10 for a return trip which the money can be used for a text book from school.Therefore  the government should subsidie public transport for students in full time education.

attributes.action: Improve the A21. Eliminate blindspots and place speed cameras along Kent street
attributes.background: There have been a number of fatalities along Kent street in 2016. One being on the 13 of August. Vast stretches of the a21 are seriously outdated and need improving. I'm asking that the government improve the a21 especially Kent street, by eke imitating blindspots and placing average speed cameras.
attributes.additional_details: There have been a number of letters to the government by residents of Kent street asking for changes, but nothing has been done. All the plans to improve the a21 have been shelved, and I'm asking that the government step in and change the road. 4 fatalities this year are evidence that something needs to be done.

attributes.action: Amend the Harassment Act 1997 to stop criminalisation of those with disabilities
attributes.background: The clauses that were inserted into the amended version of the act has resulted in individuals that lack social understanding/capacity due to a disability being criminalised under this law reform. The act states that a person ‘ought to know their actions amounted to harassment of another’.
attributes.additional_details:
Individuals with these types of conditions lack social understanding. 
There needs to be an alternative to criminalising these individuals.

‘It costs £65,000 to process an individual through the criminal justice system.  According to the Focus Prisoner Education website, ‘prisoners with health conditions cost more on top of that standard figure to accommodate in prison’ (Focus Prisoner Education, 2015, http://www.fpe.org.uk).

attributes.action: To guarantee the rights of EU nationals in the UK and UK nationals in the EU
attributes.background: Following the EU referendum, the futures of EU nationals living in the UK and UK nationals living in EU countries are completely unknown. We demand that they are allowed to remain in the country of their choice.
attributes.additional_details: This petition does not seek to overturn the recent referendum result or request a second referendum.  It simply seeks to ensure that any Brexit deal guarantees the residency and employment rights of EU nationals living in Britain and Britons living in other EU countries which are not currently guaranteed. This has left many individuals and their families uncertain of their futures.

attributes.action: To make sure all voulunteers on school trips are DBS/CRB checked
attributes.background: A primary school child, as young as 4 years can legally go on a school trip in a group of 6 children with one career. The career can be anyone connected to the school i.e parent, grandparent, a parents partner etc. The volunteers do not legally have to be DBS checked.
attributes.additional_details: A primary school child, as young as 4 years can legally go on a school trip in a group of 6 children with one career. The career can be anyone connected to the school i.e parent, grandparent, a parents partner etc. The volunteers do not legally have to be DBS checked. This means that the person caring for a child for the day could have anything on their criminal record and the school would not know about this.

attributes.action: Hold a Parliamentary debate on Social Media Abuse
attributes.background: Social media abuse, including cyberbulling, trolling, sexting and grooming, are negatively affecting thousands of teenagers' lives on a daily basis, culminating in self harm, alcoholism, mental illness and suicide. We wish for the companies responsible to take additional steps to police their sites.
attributes.additional_details: The NSPCC, along with Barnados, have a huge amount of data highlighting the serious issues teenagers are dealing with when becoming victims of social media abuse. Not enough safeguards are deployed within these sites to deal with the amount of abuse aimed at our children which leave parents in total despair. The level of abuse affects our children in many ways with poor exam results, disengagement within society, drug and alcohol abuse, eating disorders and in some cases self harm and suicide.

attributes.action: Where a partner dies before Retirement Age,transfer pension to Partner,for 5yrs
attributes.background: As part of the social care package I would propose that all persons whose life companion, partner, spouse, Husband or Wife died before that reached the stipulated Retirement Age to receive their partners pension, non-means-tested, for a period of Five years after the date of the loved one.
attributes.additional_details: This would also ease the burden on social care and health and be a clear signal of a Steadfast commitment to tackle the crisis of pensioner poverty, social care, and relive the impossible burden upon our NHS

attributes.action: Install adequate road lighting on the A249 sittingbourne
attributes.background:
Night time driving is never easy,  and unlit roads are a major hazard to all of us using them at night. 
The A249, sittingbourne is a perfect example of this problem.  Something needs to be done before more accidents happen!!!!
attributes.additional_details: From the m20, onto the A249, past Detling Hill through to keycole roundabout, the lighting at night is ridiculously poor & so dangerous to drivers using this stretch of road at night. There is no street lighting & also no cats eyes on the road, and road markings are very worn and near invisable

attributes.action: Please give extra money to keep our Isle of Wight acute inpatient hospital open.
attributes.background: Hampshire and Isle of Wight Sustainability and Transformation Plan [HIOW STP] has been published. The plan is to reduce overall running costs in the area. But we might lose 300 hospital beds. Acutely ill Isle of Wight patients need inpatient facilities near to home, not "ferried to the mainland".
attributes.additional_details: https://onthewight.com/petitions-protect-health-services-on-the-isle-of-wight-gaining-support/

attributes.action: Give a fine to parents if their children are persistent bullies.
attributes.background: I am asking for this petition to be signed so parents realise if they do not prevent their children from bullying other children persistently they would face a fine.
attributes.additional_details: As an aunty to my niece, who was bullied on many occasions, mainly from the same girl, I'm sure I speak for many parents who have found it devastating to watch someone go through this ordeal. This not only affects them, it actually changes them as a person. So would really be greatful for this to come into effect.

attributes.action: Conduct a 2nd, more complex, EU membership referendum with multiple answers.
attributes.background: The first EU membership referendum had polarised wording and lacked options which truly reflected the range of sentiment toward the EU found across the UK. To empower the people, a more complex range of possible outcomes should be provided which serves both the voter and the EU/next generation.
attributes.additional_details: 1st EU referendum.

attributes.action: To review the sentencing guidelines for offences of deliberate animal cruelty
attributes.background: The existing penalties for animal cruelty are far too lenient and do not act as a deterrent. The sentencing guidelines for offences under the Animal Health Act need reviewing to introduce much tougher sentences for deliberately & wilfully causing suffering and death to animals, eg minimum sentences
attributes.additional_details: Our existing animal welfare legislation is rooted in times when animals were seen as possessions, chattels, or tools of a trade. The current maximum sentences available do nothing to deter the people who indulge in deliberate cruelty for "fun", or who take part in dog fighting or other illegal activities. The introduction of a minimum custodial sentence on conviction of say, three or four years, with no remission or parole, would act as more of a threat to these people and make them think twice.

attributes.action: Regulate agency fees for tenants in the letting market to reduce excessive fees.
attributes.background: Letting agencies vary widely in the fees they charge from company to company and by region. It is often unclear exactly what you are paying for. High reference fees, checkout fees, and other charges, on top of depoisits, are unfair to tenants and make moving home unaffordable to many.

attributes.action: Reduce the validity period of Energy Performance Certificates to 1 year.
attributes.background: When selling or renting a property an EPC must be produced and provided to any potential buyer or tenant prior to the property being marketed. Currently the certificate is valid for 10 years and can be very misleading as a property rating may have increased or decreased due to modifications.
attributes.additional_details: It is my opinion that the EPC provided to the property purchaser or tenant should be an up to date document giving the current rating of the property. The EPC should be no more than 6 months old to give a true reflection of current running costs and an up to date reflection of the current heating system and insulation measures.

attributes.action: Provide a clear and open way to reply to government responses to petitions
attributes.background: The petitions website was set up as a way for the electorate to influence policy and hold the government to account. While this is an excellent tool for improving communication between the public and the government, the responses are frequently dismissive with no recourse for the public to reply.
attributes.additional_details:
When responses are dismissive or ignore the core concerns of the people, it increases disillusionment and leads to disenfranchisement. In order to improve the power of this democratic tool to hold the government to account, there needs to be a clear, open and visible way for the public to reply to the government responses. 

Please provide a way for the public to reply and engage with government responses to improve the power of this tool.

attributes.action: Make Personal Independence Payment (PIP) claims fairer for adults with Autism.
attributes.background: Those with Autism (ASD) can find verbalising difficulties challenging. When considering PIP, the DWP should more carefully assess those with social and communication difficulties, by discussing more with medical professionals, rather than relying on the opinions of an assessor who briefly met them.
attributes.additional_details: My husband moved over from highest level care and lowest level mobility Disability Living Allowance, to the the new PIP system. He has a number of conditions including ASD and mental health difficulties, yet scored 0 on his PIP claim, and as a direct result became suicidal. Those with ASD can mask difficulties, and behaviours can vary; how can an assessment which takes place in their own home environment, with their trusted person present, be a true representation of their usual daily struggles?

attributes.action: End the ban on the creation of new grammar schools
attributes.background: Planned expansions of existing grammar schools will not be enough to address educational inequality; bright children who live nowhere near to a potential expanded grammar school are being failed.  The ban on the creation of new grammar schools must be repealed.
attributes.additional_details:
Your postcode should not determine your quality of education. Yet the gulf between the worst and best state schools is large and for many, private school is not an option. This has created severe educational inequality, which academic selection will help to address.

Grammar schools should be a top priority in improving opportunities for bright, poorer students. The government should allow the creation of new grammar schools to widen access to a rigorous, traditional and academic education.

attributes.action: Introduce Politics and Citizenship to the core UK school curriculum
attributes.background: In light of the recent Brexit and US presidential election, we strongly believe that all students should understand the nature of politics and their role and responsibilities as citizens and voters.

attributes.action: Debate the implementation of a carbon tax in the House of Commons
attributes.background:
Climate change is currently happening and economic experts cite a carbon tax as a solid and progressive step. Reducing carbon consumption and also taxation needed from other sources. 

Carbon tax would drastically reduce the rates of income tax. More money for you and a better environment.
attributes.additional_details:
https://www.carbontax.org/why-a-carbon-tax/

'A robust tax on carbon pollution will create powerful incentives inducing policy-makers and individuals to reduce carbon emissions through conservation, substitution and innovation' 

'Currently, the prices of electricity, gasoline and other fuels reflect little or none of the long-term costs from climate change or even the near-term health costs of burning fossil fuels'

attributes.action: Abolish unisex toilets in primary and secondary schools
attributes.background: In my child's school the toilets have become unisex. The school gave parents and children no notice prior to this happening. My child was shocked when a boy walked into the toilet. The girls in the school do not like it and some boys and girls have stopped using the toilet. This is a health concern.
attributes.additional_details:
These toilets are not like the ones we have at home with the sink, bin toilet in one room behind a closed door. There is a gap at the bottom and the top, there is no privacy. 

Both genders will be going through hormonal & bodily changes. Some girls start their menstrual cycle early. Will they not be embarrassed to use a shared toilet 

Both girls & boys have the right to explore their bodies in their own privacy amongst the same gender. The unisex toilets restrict this development which is sad.

attributes.action: Scrap HS2. Spend the money on existing infrastructure, trains and rolling stock
attributes.background: HS2 benefits very few people. It is already £200m over budget. The Sheffield connection is cancelled and route has changed. The money is better spent on improving existing routes and reinstating some of the old routes to increase access to a greater proportion of the population.

attributes.action: Scrap interest rates on student loans.
attributes.background: Interest charged on student loans should be scrapped for everyone who has one and for students of the future. The continual rise in the interest charged is making paying the loans back even harder and unfair.

attributes.action: Class babies that have passed from 12 weeks on as stillbirth not miscarriage!
attributes.background: My daughter passed at 16 weeks gestation and i delivered her naturally at 20 weeks. She was perfect in everyway. Toes fingers everything all perfectly formed. She just wasnt alive. Shes down 'officially' as a miscarriage and i think the law on this needs changed!!
attributes.additional_details: Unfortunately a lot of babies who have passed before 24 weeks and are 'categorized' as a miscarriage. This itself is a miscarriage of justice. Our children were here, we held them, we talked to them. They may have been born sleeping but they were still born!!

attributes.action: Increase awareness and services for those suffering from eating disorders
attributes.background: We the undersigned ask that the government both develop greater awareness and increase funding to mental health services for those suffering from an eating disorder.
attributes.additional_details: We are a group of students from the University of Exeter campaigning to raise awareness of the lack of support for sufferers of eating disorders, particularly in the South West.

attributes.action: Empower the Police to seize and destroy Mobile Phones
attributes.background: So many people are killed or injured every week as a result of road traffic accidents where mobile phone distraction is the cause. Please sign & support this petition. you will be saving lives!

attributes.action: Let merchants choose to trade using Imperial and/or Metric measurements.
attributes.background: EU law requires UK merchants to display weights and measures in metric units. Simultaneous display of Imperial units is allowed as an afterthought. Per Brexit, Parliament should enact a law allowing merchants to choose to display weights and measures in either Imperial or Metric units, or jointly.

attributes.action: Allow the british army to grow beards like the navy
attributes.background: It should be allowed for the british army to grow beards, the navy are allowed so why isnt the army? If you are in the british army and you are a sikh then you can grow a beard, this goes against equalitiy and diversity.
attributes.additional_details: The navy has regulations and guidelines for what classes as a beard, why can the army not have the same?

attributes.action: Make it law that all cyclists have to wear helmets.
attributes.background: After seeing the damage falling from a bicycle can cause I feel it should now be law for anyone using a cycle to have to wear a cycle helmet !  More bicycles are now capable of the same speeds as mopeds and scooters and some electric bicycles can reach speeds in excess of 20mph! lets make this law..
attributes.additional_details:
Studies show that wearing a helmet can make it 70% less likely that you suffer major head trauma should you fall off or be involved in an accident while riding a bicycle. If you think your to cool to wear one spend an hour in the NCCU and think again.
We have rules and regulations for many things less damaging lets make this law and save lives.
